entries.claim_text: Victoria Police had to step in after a Facebook post was shared more than 100,000 times saying a warehouse in Melbourne was stockpiling food and sanitary items to send overseas.
entries.debunking_information: The claim was investigated and found to be false by Victoria Police after checking with the company.

entries.claim_text: The police checked with the company and it wasn't.
entries.debunking_information: This clarifies that the warehouse was not stockpiling items to send overseas, correcting the misinformation.

entries.claim_text: Another Facebook post shared over 40,000 times claimed inhaling the steam from boiled oranges with cayenne pepper will get rid of coronavirus by making infected mucus stream from your nose.
entries.debunking_information: Medical experts have confirmed this claim is false; inhaling such steam does not cure or remove coronavirus infection.

entries.claim_text: But President Trump also claimed the drug had already been approved by America's Food and Drug Administration as a treatment.
entries.debunking_information: At the time, chloroquine had not been approved by the FDA for COVID-19 treatment, making this claim factually incorrect.
This statement corrects the previous misinformation about FDA approval status.

entries.claim_text: Sadly, that fact check came too late for an American man who swallowed fish medicine containing chloroquine phosphate after seeing Mr Trump's comments on TV.
entries.debunking_information: This is a factual report of a tragic incident linked to misinformation about chloroquine's safety and efficacy.

entries.claim_text: He died and his wife is in hospital.
entries.debunking_information: This is a factual statement related to the previous claim about the consequences of misinformation.

entries.claim_text: Hands above your head now you stay the new beginnings
entries.debunking_information: The claim is unclear and ambiguous, making it unverifiable as a factual statement.

entries.claim_text: They got your name address. They got everything
entries.debunking_information: This claim is vague and lacks context, making it impossible to verify the accuracy of 'they' and what 'everything' entails.

entries.claim_text: Come to feels ammunation today. We got more guns
entries.debunking_information: Without context or verification of the business or event, this claim cannot be confirmed as true or false.
